Name.label: Rare thrombotic disorder due to a constitutional coagulation factors defect

TextSection.Contents: Familial thrombomodulin anomalies is a rare, life-threatening, genetic coagulation disorder characterized by an increased risk of blood clot formation in several members of a family due to a thrombomodulin gene mutation. Patients may manifest with venous thromboembolic disease, premature myocardial infarction and/or arterial thrombosis.
